feed.title: SAP Community - ABAP Cloud
feed.subtitle: ABAP Cloud Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: Getting Error 'npm error missing: @sap/hdi-deploy@^5' When deploying the developments to DB.
entry.content:
Hello All,

I'm following the steps given in this tutorial https://developers.sap.com/tutorials/hana-cloud-cap-create-database-cds.html

I'm getting the below errors while deploying the Developments. Please help me to resolve them. Thank you.

entry.title: 3rd level child in RAP managed scenario does not navigate to Identification facet
entry.content:
I used Parent->Child->Grandchild relationship in managed RAP Scenario and used the standard create, update, delete. I created V4 UI Service binding and checked the Preview.  All the navigation works except from the 3rd level. When I select one row of Grandchild, it does not show the Identification facet. This issue is not there in V2 UI Service.

Here is the behavior definition and Metadata extension screenshots.

managed implementation in class zbp_i_school unique;
//strict;
with draft;

define behavior for ZI_SCHOOL alias schooldetails
persistent table zschool_det
draft table zschool_det_d

lock master total etag lastchangeddate
authorization master ( instance )
etag master locallastchangeddate
{
  create;
  update;
  delete;

  draft action Activate optimized;
  draft action Discard;
  draft action Edit;
  draft action Resume;
  draft determine action Prepare;


  field ( readonly : update ) SchoolId;
  action ( features : instance ) setOpenStatus result [1] $self;

  association _zchild { create; with draft; }


  mapping for zschool_det
    {
      SchoolId   = school_id;
      SchoolName = school_name;
      Location   = location;
      Medium     = medium;
      OpenNow    = open_now;
    }
}

define behavior for ZI_STUDENT alias studentBD
authorization dependent by _zparent
persistent table zstudent_det
draft table zstudent_det_d
lock dependent by _zparent
{

  update;
  delete;

  association _zparent { with draft; }
  association _zgchild { create; with draft; }


  field ( readonly : update ) SchoolId;
  field ( readonly : update ) StudentId;

  mapping for zstudent_det
    {
      StudentId   = student_id;
      SchoolId    = school_id;
      StudentName = student_name;
      Birthdate   = birthdate;
    }
}

define behavior for ZI_SCORE alias scoreBD
authorization dependent by _zparent
persistent table zscore_det
draft table zscore_det_d
lock dependent by _zparent
{

  update;
  delete;

  association _zchild { with draft; }
  association _zparent { with draft; }

  field ( readonly : update ) SchoolId;
  field ( readonly : update ) StudentId;
  field ( readonly : update ) SubjectId;
  field ( readonly : update ) Class;

  mapping for zscore_det
    {
      Class       = class;
      SchoolId    = school_id;
      StudentId   = student_id;
      SubjectId   = subject_id;
      SubjectName = subject_name;
      Marks       = marks;
    }

}
@Metadata.layer: #CORE

@UI: { headerInfo: { typeName: 'Subject', typeNamePlural: 'Subjects',
                     title: { type: #STANDARD, label: 'Subject Det Title', value: 'SubjectName' } } }
annotate view ZC_SCORE with
{

  .facet: [ { position: 10, label: 'Score Detail', purpose: #STANDARD,
                     type: #IDENTIFICATION_REFERENCE } ]


  : { lineItem: [{ position: 10, label: 'Subject ID' }],
                      identification: [{ position: 10, label: 'Subject ID'  }]  }
  SubjectId;

  : { lineItem: [{ position: 20, label: 'Class' }],
                      identification: [{ position: 20, label: 'Class'  }]  }
  Class;

  : { lineItem: [{ position: 30, label: 'Student ID' }],
                      identification: [{ position: 30, label: 'Student ID'  }]  }
  StudentId;


  : { lineItem: [{ position: 40, label: 'School ID' }],
                      identification: [{ position: 40, label: 'School ID'  }]  }
  SchoolId;

  : { lineItem: [{ position: 50, label: 'Subject Name' }],
                      identification: [{ position: 50, label: 'Subject Name'  }]  }
  SubjectName;


  : { lineItem: [{ position: 60, label: 'Score' }],
                      identification: [{ position: 60, label: 'Score'  }]  }
  Marks;

}

Please let me know what I am missing? Let me know if you need more code details.

entry.title: Not able to update Issuing Storage Location - RESLO - field during PR Creation using BO interface
entry.content:
Hello experts,

We’ve built a custom app on SAP Public Cloud using the RAP framework and the Business Object interface I_PURCHASEREQUISITIONTP.

The app enables the creation of stock transfer purchase requisitions between logical storage locations within the same plant, using item category "U".

However, we need to populate the field "Issuing Storage Location – RESLO", which currently does not appear to be available in the Business Object interface, nor accessible via any custom logic options we’ve explored.

Does anyone have experience or suggestions to help us manage this situation?

Thanks

Caterina

entry.title: Custom Entity as ABAP Cloud form data provider leading entity
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

Can a ABAP RAP custom entity be used as a leading entity of a form data provider? I am working on embedded steampunk of S/4HANA Cloud 2508 version and have built a form object with a service definition where I have exposed a custom entity as a leading entity but the form object is erroring out.

I have added necessary annotations to service definition and the custom entity respectively. These annotations works for a CDS view entity but not for a custom entity or a CDS view defined using 'define view' syntax.

Does it mean that a custom entity cannot be used in form object?

@PascalBremer 

Best regards,

Sumit

entry.title: SAP Public Cloud RAP Custom entity unmanaged how to update?
entry.content:
Hi experts,

when i use custom entity,how can i update entity in unmanaged?
I just want update entity,don't update table.

 

 

Best regards
JamesG

entry.title: Double Periods (". . ") Not Throwing Syntax Error In ABAP.
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I am practicing ABAP and I have a small doubt regarding syntax.

In my code, I accidentally wrote:  IF sy-subrc = 0.
WRITE: 'Success'.
ENDIF..   

or at any ending statement if i give dot after the dot ( .. ), it gives me no syntax error and successfully activated the program. 

Is this expected behavior in ABAP? Why doesn’t the system flag this as an error?
Would appreciate if someone could clarify the reasoning behind this.

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Is there an ABAP equivalent of JavaDocs for SAP classes and methods?
entry.content:
Hi all,

In Java, they have Javadocs  that provide a complete API reference for classes, listing all methods, parameters, return types, and usage examples. I’m looking for something similar in ABAP.  

Specifically, is there an official SAP documentation page that provides a Javadoc-style API reference for standard ABAP classes? i.e. the equivalent of https://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/api/

entry.title: FIORI APP extensibility
entry.content:
I need to extend a standard Fiori application with a custom field. Normally, the recommended approach would be to use the Custom Fields and Logic app, which automatically creates a new field (with the ZZ1_ prefix) in the relevant table and exposes it to Fiori.

However, in my case, the situation is different:

The customer has already added a custom field ZCLASS in table MARD using an append structure and this field is already in use across multiple forms, reports (so it’s business critical)

If I use the Custom Fields and Logic app now, it will create a new field ZZ1_CLASS in MARD, which would lead to redundant fields for the same purpose.

My question is what is the correct approach to resolve this issue?

Thank you In advance

entry.title: SAP ABAP Developer for Custom Module Development
entry.content: Looking for an SAP technical consultant to develop custom business logic and integration components for our ERP implementation. Need assistance with ABAP programming for custom reports and data extraction routines, workflow configuration and approval process automation, user exit and enhancement implementation for standard SAP transactions, interface development using IDocs and RFC connections for third-party system integration, custom transaction creation with screen design and validation logic, and performance optimization for existing ABAP programs and database queries. Requirements include strong ABAP programming skills with SAP development workbench experience, knowledge of SAP module integration (FI/CO, MM, SD) and business process workflows, understanding of SAP transport management and change request procedures, experience with debugging tools and performance analysis techniques. Timeline: 1-2 days, remote SAP system access required.

entry.title: SAP Public Cloud - Adobe Forms: Extend data source and layout
entry.content:
Hello,

I have some questions about forms in S4 Public Cloud. I hope you can help clarify my thoughts.

First, I wanted to know if there is a way to extend the data source of a form without having to create customer fields. My customer's requirement is to print data on the form that isn't in the data source. For example, to print data from the related delivery or the intercompany purchase order on the sales order. Therefore, I don't need to create custom fields; this information is already in SAP. I need to extend the data source and dynamically populate this extension with the necessary information. I don't want to create new customer fields in the database.

Another requirement from my customer is to group sales order items by material group. That is, they don't want to print items 10, 20, 30, etc. They want to group by the material group field and first print a header (Material Group 1) and below it all the items in that material group. Then they'll print another header (Material Group 2) and the items in that material group... In S4 Private, I would have developed this type of logic in the print/BADI program, form context, or form interface. But in S4 Public, I don't have any of these options. Can the data source be extended and a completely customized data structure developed by me be added? Are these types of groupings developed directly with Javascript in the Adobe form?

Kind Regards.

entry.title: Passed SAP Certified Associate – ABAP Cloud (C_ABAPD_2507)
entry.content:
I’m happy to share that I’ve passed the SAP Certified Associate – Back-End Developer – ABAP Cloud (C_ABAPD_2507) exam.

For preparation, I mainly relied on Exam4lead practice tests, which helped me:

Understand the exam pattern

Identify weaker areas for review

Build confidence with time management

I hope this helps anyone preparing for the certification. Consistency with practice tests was the key for me. Wishing good luck to all learners on this journey!

entry.title: MDG replication of field not successful
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

I am newbie in Webservices and need some second opinions from you guys.

My Business Analyst told me that the field KNA1-RPMKR should be copied from source system to target system. We use the transaction DRFOUT to perform this.

No errors were found in SRT_MONI and DRFOUT as well.

Unfortunately, the field does not get copied even though it has a value in the source system.

The question is, should I ask for help from SAP since this standard class CL_MDG_BP_RPLCTRQ and standard method BP_SUITEBULK_REPL_REQ_IN also in SPROXY the service definition is SAP standard BusinessPartnerSUITEBulkReplic?

If not, then what will be my next step?

Please help.

Newguy_cloud

entry.title: API "Billing Document - Read, Cancel, GetPDF" : how to consume in ABAP Cloud ?
entry.content:
Dear All,

Requirement : in S/4HANA Public Cloud, reading Header Texts from a Billing Document, in ABAP Cloud

To fulfill this requirement, the CDS entity "I_BillingDocumentTextTP" cannot be used, as it does not return the LongText.

Therefore, I want to consume the API "API_BILLING_DOCUMENT_SRV" in ABAP Cloud.

I'm following the steps as described in https://api.sap.com/api/API_BILLING_DOCUMENT_SRV/cloud-sdk/ABAP

--> Generating Proxies for Remote OData Service.

I have created a Service Consumption Model :

I have copied the code of the Entity Set A_BillingDocumentText into my class, and I have added the input parameters for the method "cl_http_destination_provider=>create_by_comm_arrangement"

 

 DATA:
      ls_entity_key    TYPE z_scm_api_billing_document_srv=>tys_a_billing_document_text_ty,
      ls_business_data TYPE z_scm_api_billing_document_srv=>tys_a_billing_document_text_ty,
      lo_http_client   TYPE REF TO if_web_http_client,
      lo_resource      TYPE REF TO /iwbep/if_cp_resource_entity,
      lo_client_proxy  TYPE REF TO /iwbep/if_cp_client_proxy,
      lo_request       TYPE REF TO /iwbep/if_cp_request_read,
      lo_response      TYPE REF TO /iwbep/if_cp_response_read.

    TRY.
        " Create http client
        TRY.
            DATA(lo_destination) = cl_http_destination_provider=>create_by_comm_arrangement(
                                                         comm_scenario  = 'SAP_COM_0120'
                                                         comm_system_id = 'CPI'
                                                         service_id     = 'BD_CONFIRMATION_OUT_SPRX'
                                                         ).
          CATCH cx_http_dest_provider_error INTO DATA(cx_http_dest_provider_error).
            RAISE SHORTDUMP cx_http_dest_provider_error.
        ENDTRY.

        lo_http_client = cl_web_http_client_manager=>create_by_http_destination( lo_destination ).
        lo_client_proxy = /iwbep/cl_cp_factory_remote=>create_v2_remote_proxy(
          EXPORTING
             is_proxy_model_key       = VALUE #( repository_id       = 'DEFAULT'
                                                 proxy_model_id      = 'Z_SCM_API_BILLING_DOCUMENT_SRV'
                                                 proxy_model_version = '0001' )
            io_http_client             = lo_http_client
            iv_relative_service_root   = '/sap/opu/odata/sap/API_BILLING_DOCUMENT_SRV/' ).

        ASSERT lo_http_client IS BOUND.


        " Set entity key
        ls_entity_key = VALUE #(
                  billing_document  = '0090000122'
                  language          = 'E'
                  long_text_id      = 'TX06' ).

        " Navigate to the resource
        lo_resource = lo_client_proxy->create_resource_for_entity_set( 'A_BILLING_DOCUMENT_TEXT' )->navigate_with_key( ls_entity_key ).

        " Execute the request and retrieve the business data
        lo_response = lo_resource->create_request_for_read( )->execute( ).
        lo_response->get_business_data( IMPORTING es_business_data = ls_business_data ).

      CATCH /iwbep/cx_cp_remote INTO DATA(lx_remote).
        " Handle remote Exception
        " It contains details about the problems of your http(s) connection

      CATCH /iwbep/cx_gateway INTO DATA(lx_gateway).
        " Handle Exception

      CATCH cx_web_http_client_error INTO DATA(lx_web_http_client_error).
        " Handle Exception
        RAISE SHORTDUMP lx_web_http_client_error.


    ENDTRY.

 

The Communication Arrangement is as follows :

 

When I run the code, an exception is raised by the method cl_http_destination_provider=>create_by_comm_arrangement: 

Error :
{O:353*\CLASS=CX_HTTP_DEST_PROVIDER_ERROR} Internal error [CM_HTTP_DEST_PROV(004)] CL_HTTP_DESTINATION_PROVIDER [Line:265]

 

The raise location is :

 

What can be the reason for this raised exception ?

 

Many thanks

 

Hans Segers

entry.title: Modify the BKPF-WWERT field of the accounting entry in the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition system.
entry.content:
Hello Experts, good afternoon.

I need to modify the “Conversion date” field. / BKPF-WWERT"  from the accounting entry through a BADI, EXIT, Replacement, Custom Logic, or any other tool in the system SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition - ABAP CLOUD. However, I haven't been able to find a way to modify it.

Please, is there any way to modify that value in the FI accounting entry?

 

On the other hand, in the SAP OnPremise version, it was possible to modify it and there were options available. However, in SAP S/4 Cloud, there do not appear to be any options.

 

I look forward to any suggestions or support.

Thank you very much.

@ABAPCloud_Developer 

SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 

ABAP Extensibility 

ABAP Cloud 

FIN (Finance) 

Best regards,

entry.title: RAP ABAP Runtime Error – CONVT_NO_NUMBER
entry.content:
Dear All,

While working in the RAP application, we are encountering the following ABAP runtime error: 'CONVERT_NO_NUMBER'.
This occurs when entering a value in the Attach ID field.

It appears the system is attempting to convert a non-numeric value into a numeric type, which is causing the issue. Kindly look into the data type handling or conversion logic in the relevant field or binding.

Your support in resolving this issue is appreciated.

 

 

but my field data type is char32. so please help.

entry.content:
Hi

I also need where the sticky notes text are saved . 

I have to pull these all text into a report . 

 

Please help,

Bharti

entry.title: Any API or EML for posting with clearing for vendor transfer?
entry.content:
Hi experts,

I really hope that your knowledge help me with this problem.

Currently I need to create a program that allows to transfer posting with clearing in Cloud Public. This process was cover in On-Premise system by the FB05 transaction and its respectives BAPIS.

But now I tried to do the process with the API JournalEntryBulkClearingRequest_In (API Reference | Journal Entry - Clearing (Asynchronous) | SAP Business Accelerator Hub) but is not possible because it required to indicate the bill and the payment, in this case I only has the bill.

I tried with EML but the entity I_JOURNALENTRYTP doesn't have the clearing scenario.

entry.title: Update the status to “Sent to bank” in the Monitor Payments application - SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud
entry.content:
Hello Experts, good afternoon.

We are currently implementing scope item 2YM for the automatic payment process. This API allows integration with CPI so that the file can then be sent to the bank. Likewise, the payment formats used are customized Z formats due to the requirement.

On the other hand, the SAP BCM solution is not being used in its entirety due to cost issues.

API Implemented

My question is as follows:

- How do I update the following statuses: “Sent to Bank,” “Completed” in the following application?

- Is there a BADI, Custom Logic, API, or missing configuration that allows me to update the statuses?

Thank you very much.

I look forward to any support and/or recommendations.

Best regards,

entry.title: RAP Using Custom Entity with load multiple data using Pagination and Preview using UI annotations
entry.content:
This blog covers RAP development using a custom entity, showcasing data with UI annotations, and surpassing the standard SAP data preview limit through the use of pagination.

Lets Start....

Step 1: Create a custom entity with the fields that need to be displayed or sent to the frontend.

@EndUserText.label: 'Custom entity for fetching data'
@ObjectModel.query.implementedBy: 'ABAP:ZCL_IMPLEMENT_EXT' //This is the class where the data is handle and processed
@UI:{ headerInfo:{  typeName: 'RAP Learn',
                             typeNamePlural: 'RAP Learn',
                             title: { label: 'RAP Learn',
                                       type: #STANDARD,
                                       value: 'component'
                                     },
                             description: { value: 'obj_desc' },
                                     typeImageUrl: 'sap-icon://activity-items' //Show Icon image on header of object layout
                           }
               }
@Search.searchable: true //for Searching the data from the output which is also need to implement in the implemented class above 
define root custom entity ZCE_MAIN
{
      @ui.facet   : [{
                      id: 'ID1',
                      purpose: #STANDARD,
                      type: #IDENTIFICATION_REFERENCE,
                      label : 'Component detail',
                      position: 10
                    },
                    {
                id: 'FG1',
                purpose: #STANDARD,
                type: #FIELDGROUP_REFERENCE,
                label : 'Validity Date',
                targetQualifier: 'FG1',
                position: 10
              }]
      @ui         : {  selectionField: [{ position: 10 }]}
      @Consumption.filter.mandatory: true
      @Consumption.valueHelpDefinition: [{
                            entity : { name: 'ZIV_F4MATNR' , element: 'matnr'   } ,
                            additionalBinding: [{ localElement: 'werks', element: 'werks' },
                                                         {  localElement: 'stlan' , element: 'stlan' },
                                                         {  localElement: 'stlal' , element: 'stlal' }]}]
      @Consumption.filter.selectionType: #SINGLE
  key matnr       : matnr;
      @ui         : {  selectionField: [{ position: 20 }]}
      @Consumption.filter.mandatory: true
      @Consumption.valueHelpDefinition: [{
                      entity : { name: 'ZIV_F4WERKS', element: 'werks' }
                                                         }]
      @Consumption.filter.selectionType: #SINGLE
  key werks       : werks_d;
      @ui         : {  selectionField: [{ position: 30 }]}
      @Consumption.filter.mandatory: true
      @Consumption.valueHelpDefinition: [{
                entity : { name: 'ZIV_F4STLAN' , element: 'stlan' }
                                                   }]
      @Consumption.filter.selectionType: #SINGLE
  key stlan       : stlan;
      @ui         : {  selectionField: [{ position: 40 }]}
      @Consumption.filter.mandatory: true
      @Consumption.filter.selectionType: #SINGLE
  key stlal       : stlal;
      @ui         : { lineItem: [{ position: 10 }], identification: [{ position: 10 }]}
      @EndUserText.label: 'Level'
  key bom_level   : abap.dec( 2, 0 );
      @ui         : { lineItem: [{ position: 20 }], identification: [{ position: 20 }]}
      @EndUserText.label: 'Component'
      @search.defaultSearchElement: true
  key component   : idnrk;
      @ui         : {  selectionField: [{ position: 50 }]}
      @Consumption.filter.mandatory: true
      @Consumption.filter.selectionType: #SINGLE
      @EndUserText.label: 'Date'
      zdate       : abap.dats;
      @ui         : { lineItem: [{ position: 30, cssDefault: { width: '13rem' }  }], identification: [{ position: 30 }]}
      @EndUserText.label: 'Object Description'
      @search.defaultSearchElement: true
      obj_desc    : maktx;
      @ui         : { lineItem: [{ position: 35, cssDefault: { width: '8rem' } }], identification: [{ position: 35 }]}
      @EndUserText.label: 'Quantity'
      comp_qty    : kmpmg_bi;
      @ui         : { lineItem: [{ position: 45 }], identification: [{ position: 45 }]}
      @EndUserText.label: 'Unit'
      comp_unit   : kmpme;
      @ui         : { lineItem: [{ position: 55 }], fieldGroup: [{ position: 10 , qualifier: 'FG1', label: 'Valid From' }]}
      @EndUserText.label: 'Valid from'
      valid_from  : datuv_bi;
      @ui         : { lineItem: [{ position: 65 }], fieldGroup: [{ position: 11 , qualifier: 'FG1', label: 'Valid To' }]}
      @EndUserText.label: 'Valid to'
      valid_to    : datub_bi;
}


While using the RAP framework, metadata extensions cannot be created for custom entities. Therefore, annotations must be directly included in the custom entity code itself for UI purposes.

Step 2 : Create an implementation class for the custom entity mentioned above and name it ZCL_IMPLEMENT_EXT or use the custom name specified in the second line of the code.

CLASS zcl_implement_ext DEFINITION
  PUBLIC
  FINAL
  CREATE PUBLIC
  SHARED MEMORY ENABLED .

  PUBLIC SECTION.
    DATA : et_final TYPE TABLE OF zce_main.
    INTERFACES if_rap_query_provider .

  PROTECTED SECTION.
  PRIVATE SECTION.

ENDCLASS.



CLASS ZCL_IMPLEMENT_EXT IMPLEMENTATION.

  METHOD if_rap_query_provider~select.
    CASE io_request->get_entity_id( ).
      WHEN 'ZCE_MAIN'.
        TRY.
            DATA(lv_skip) = io_request->get_paging( )->get_offset( ). "gets the skip part from URL which means number of data to be skipped and default is 0 but later on it gets add by 20... till last data not get fetched
            DATA(lv_top) = io_request->get_paging( )->get_page_size( ). "gets the top part from URL which means number of data required and default is 20
            DATA(lt_filter) = io_request->get_filter( )->get_as_ranges( ). "gets the input value which is either pass in our filters or when click on single data line item
           
          CATCH cx_rap_query_filter_no_range.
            "handle exception
        ENDTRY.

        IF lv_top < 0.
*********** Start Logic
"Put logic for single data fetch in which it will trigger when you are going for object page while clicking on single item from display table
"Take inputs from LT_filter table for sending that particular data click 
*********** End Logic
            IF io_request->is_total_numb_of_rec_requested( ).
              io_response->set_total_number_of_records( lines( et_final ) ).
            ENDIF.
            IF io_request->is_data_requested(  ).
              io_response->set_data( et_final ).
            ENDIF.
        ELSE.
*********** Start Logic
"Put logic for actual multiple data fetch in which it will trigger when you click go button or any sort of actions like search, sort, excel download....
"Take inputs from LT_filter table for required data fetch 
*********** End Logic
          ENDIF.
********** Searching Logic
        DATA(lv_search) = io_request->get_search_expression( ). "gets the value from Search field in the UI
          IF lv_search IS NOT INITIAL.
            DATA lt_search LIKE et_final.

            lv_search = |*{ lv_search }*|.
            lt_search = VALUE #( BASE lt_finalts
                          FOR ls_f IN et_final
                          WHERE ( field1 CP lv_search OR  "Put required field to be search instead of field1,field2.....
                                  field2 CP lv_search  OR
                                  field3 cp lv_search OR
                                  field4 cp lv_search OR                                                                
                                                       ( ls_f ) ).
            et_final = lt_search.
          ENDIF.
***********End of Searching logic
***********Sorting logic
        DATA(lt_sort_elements) = io_request->get_sort_elements( ). "gets the detail table of ascending and descending of field we wants to be sorted from UI
          IF lt_sort_elements IS NOT INITIAL.
            LOOP AT lt_sort_elements INTO DATA(ls_sort).
              IF ls_sort-descending <> 'X'.
                SORT et_final BY (ls_sort-element_name) ASCENDING.
              ELSE.
                SORT et_final BY (ls_sort-element_name) DESCENDING.
              ENDIF.
            ENDLOOP.
          ENDIF.
**********End of sorting logic
**********Paging- logic for loading more data wrt Standard set amount of data
          IF lv_top IS NOT INITIAL OR lv_skip IS NOT INITIAL.
            /iwbep/cl_mgw_data_util=>paging( EXPORTING is_paging = VALUE #( top  = lv_top
                                                                            skip = lv_skip )
                                             CHANGING  ct_data   = et_final ).
          ENDIF.
*********End of Pagination

          IF io_request->is_total_numb_of_rec_requested( ).
            io_response->set_total_number_of_records( lines( et_final ) ). "set number of initial data to display overall
          ENDIF.

          IF io_request->is_data_requested(  ).
            io_response->set_data( et_final ). "Set data into the entity
          ENDIF.

        ENDIF.
    ENDCASE.
  ENDMETHOD.

ENDCLASS.


The aforementioned class plays a crucial role as it encapsulates the entire logic for data processing, including searching, sorting, and most importantly, setting data for our custom entity.

Step 3 : Create Service Definition of the Custom entity 

To create a service definition, simply right-click the custom entity in the Project Explorer, click 'New Service Definition', fill in the required inputs, and your service definition will be created.

@EndUserText.label: 'Service definition'
define service ZSD_MAIN {
  expose ZCE_MAIN;
  expose ZIV_F4MATNR; "This is for ValueHelp Definition, and it's okay not to expose it.
  expose ZIV_F4WERKS;
  expose ZIV_F4STLAN;
}


Let's take a look at one of the interface views of the ValueHelpDefinition.

@AbapCatalog.viewEnhancementCategory: [#NONE]
@AccessControl.authorizationCheck: #NOT_REQUIRED
@EndUserText.label: 'Interface view for ValueHelpDefinition - MATNR'
@Metadata.ignorePropagatedAnnotations: true
@ObjectModel.usageType:{
    serviceQuality: #X,
    sizeCategory: #S,
    dataClass: #MIXED
}
define view entity ZIV_F4MATNR
  as select distinct from mast
    left outer join       makt on makt.matnr = mast.matnr
{
      @ui   : {  selectionField: [{ position: 10 }] , lineItem: [{ position: 10 }]}
      @EndUserText.label: 'Material No'
  key mast.matnr,
      @Consumption.filter.hidden: true
  key mast.werks,
      @Consumption.filter.hidden: true
  key mast.stlan,
      @Consumption.filter.hidden: true
  key mast.stlal,
      @Consumption.filter.hidden: true
      @ui   : {   lineItem: [{ position: 20 }]}
      @EndUserText.label: 'Material Desc'
      makt.maktx
}


Step 4 : Create a Service Binding for the aforementioned service definition.

To create a service binding, simply right-click the created service definition in the Project Explorer, click 'New Service Binding', fill in the required inputs, and your service binding will be created. While creating the Service Binding, I selected OData V2 - UI. Then, activate and publish the service. To view the UI output, you can use the Preview option in Eclipse to see the output as shown in the image below.

 

In conclusion, using RAP with custom entities and pagination facilitates efficient data handling. With UI annotations, you can easily preview and refine the user interface. We hope this guide has been helpful. Stay tuned for more tips!

 

Note: This program is created for a remote system. For cloud environments, you can use a service consumption model or access data through a remote system API in the implementation class.
